text: . Monazite is a mineral and an ore of rare earth elements. Chemically, it is a mixture of phosphates of lanthanide elements and thorium. == Refining == Dissolving monazite with sodium hydroxide makes a slurry of metal oxides. Adding hydrochloric acid makes a solution of lanthanide chlorides and a residue containing thorium dioxide. The exact process can vary depending on specific properties of the mineral. Category:Rare earth minerals Category:Phosphate minerals
title: Monazite
